intro: Plectronia congensis, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, heart-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Plectronia congensis is popular in horticulture due to its compact size and ability to bloom throughout the year.
